snippet: The country, which has often criticized other European nations about their debts and lack of competitiveness, now finds its own economic policy under attack.
abstract: Germany, which has often criticized other European nations about their debts and lack of competitiveness, now finds its own economic policy under attack; European Commission begins extensive review into whether country's huge trade surplus, which stood at 45.9 billion euros, or $61.7 billion, in second quarter, is threatening rest of bloc.

byline.original: By JACK EWING, ALISON SMALE and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, Alison Smale from Berlin and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The country, which has often criticized other European nations about their debts and lack of competitiveness, now finds its own economic policy under attack.

headline.main: Germany’s Neighbors Admonish It Over Surplus
headline.print_headline: Its Neighbors Admonish Germany Over Surplus
